actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution requiring that Federal judges be reconfirmed by the Senate every six years.

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - Limits the term of office of a judge of the United States to six years after: (1) such person took office; (2) the Senate last consented to such person's continuance in office; or (3) the ratification of this article, whichever last occurs.

titles.title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution requiring that Federal judges be reconfirmed by the Senate every six years.
